intro: Parrya stenoloma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parrya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Parrya stenoloma is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
